link.synopsis: Despite its mediocre food, Marv's restaurant has long been a fixture of Cleveland's Coventry Rd. neighborhood. But over time, its faithful patrons have given way to proto-yuppies gunning for neighborhood improvements such as shutting down Marv's. Amidst this turmoil, innocent Susan tries to hold her first job bussing tables while dodging Marv's advances and keeping in good graces with the head waitress (who's having an affair with Marv).
link.title: synopsis
Shakespeare Comedies: As You Like It
Our Hitler: A Film from Germany
Bloody Mama / A Bucket of Blood
Le Cirque: A Table in Heaven
Masterpiece Theatre: The Secret Life of Mrs. Beeton

link.synopsis: Firm up your entire body, increase your metabolism and burn fat with fitness expert Gay Gasper's cardio plus toning exercise program for intermediate to advanced fitness levels. Gasper's routine, which requires a step bench and an X-ertube, transitions from step aerobics to a combination of aerobics and toning and back to a mix of high- and low-impact aerobics. The program also includes floor work that specifically targets abdominals.
link.title: synopsis
The Parent Trap / The Parent Trap II
Christi Taylor: Ultimate Carido Core Workout
Gay Gasper's All Out Infused Step: A Step Workout
Sharon Twombly's All Body Attack: An Interval Weight Training Workout
Kim Miller: Aerobic Euphoria: Hi/Low & Step Workouts
Katina Hunter: Step Party 2: Let's Step It Up
Step: Strong and Stable with Abbie Appel

Cardio Meets Strength Training: Slow, Strong & Simple
Steppin' in Rhythm with Pam Cosmi

Mindy Mylrea: Interval Express / Action Packed
Denise Austin: Power Zone: The Ultimate Metabolism Boosting Workout
Jari Love: Get Ripped: Get Ripped 1000

title.regular: Cardio Crazy Plus Bone Core with Gay Gasper
title.short: Cardio Crazy/Bone Core with Gay Gasper

link.synopsis: In Cornered, a Canadian pilot (Dick Powell) returns to France after World War II to track down the Nazi collaborator who killed his wartime bride, and in Desperate, a truck driver and his wife (Steve Brodie and Audrey Long) find themselves on the run from both the mob and the cops. Directed by Edward Dmytryk and Anthony Mann, the films in this noir-thriller double feature co-star Micheline Cheirel, Walter Slezak and Raymond Burr.
link.title: synopsis
Armored Car Robbery / Crime in the Streets
The Killer that Stalked New York / Two of a Kind
Hammer Film Noir: A Stolen Face / Blackout
Cinema's Dark Side: Impact/ Second Woman/ They Made Me a Criminal

link.synopsis: Mexican drug kingpin Papi (Luis Felipe Tovar) enters a turf war against a team of American mafia intruders led by Mesías (Fernando Ciangherotti). But while the battle rages, the Korean mob sees an opportunity to seize power while its enemies fight each other. Ignacio Rinza directs this darkly ironic, Tarantino-esque thriller, where the action escalates into a three-way race for control of the lucrative drug trade.
link.title: synopsis
Entre La Tarde y La Noche
Si Honraras a Tu Coca Madre
La Muerte del Gallo de Oro
Dios te Bendiga Hijo Mío: Santa Martha Acatitla Penitenciaria

link.synopsis: Broadcast on the BBC in 1961, this performance by legendary vocalist Nat King Cole features many of his greatest hits, including "It's Only a Paper Moon," "Unforgettable," "Those Lazy, Hazy, Crazy Days of Summer," "Mona Lisa" and "Sweet Lorraine." Missing for more than three decades, this incredibly rare concert program presents 14 classic songs and is one of the few Cole performances filmed in color.
link.title: synopsis
Jazz Icons: Ella Fitzgerald: Live in '57 & '63
Jazz Icons: Dave Brubeck: Live in '64 & '66
Diana Krall: Live at the Montreal Jazz Festival

link.synopsis: Nat King Cole's silky voice is among America's most beloved. This tribute to the renowned jazz vocalist, part of the PBS "American Masters" series, explores the crooner's artistry and examines his career in the context of the Civil Rights movement. Rare performance footage and popular archival material testify to his immense talent, while home movies and interviews with family, fans and fellow artists speak to the man behind the legend.
link.title: synopsis
Nat King Cole: Soundies and Telescriptions
Atlantic Records: The House that Ahmet Built
Nat King Cole: When I Fall in Love: The One and Only

link.synopsis: Get a look inside Grammy-nominated R&B singer Keyshia Cole's real life as she continues to deal with the conflicts that arise in her newly reestablished relationships with her sister and her ex-con mother in the second season of this reality show. The whole family moves to Atlanta, and Cole begins to record her second album, "Just Like You." Meanwhile, she keeps working on establishing healthy ties with her family members.

link.synopsis: Rhythm-and-blues sensation Keyshia Cole stars in this BET reality series that chronicles her day-to-day struggles and successes as she talks to troubled teens, attempts to start her own record label and reaches out to her incarcerated mother. Cameras capture the action as Cole squabbles with her pie-eyed sister, appears on a radio talk show to squelch rumors and throws a party to celebrate her debut album going platinum.

link.synopsis: Photographer Scott Bruin (Jeff Lester) is haunted by the same dream every night. In this recurring dream, he goes back to the same house and murders the same woman each time. One day, that same woman (Adrienne Sachs) suddenly appears in Scott's real-life existence, and they quickly fall in love ... but it turns out to be a most unusual -- and possibly very dangerous -- relationship.
link.title: synopsis

title.regular: In the Cold of the Night
title.short: In the Cold of the Night

link.synopsis: Man's best friend is also a spy in this British espionage spoof from Daniel Petrie, starring Lionel Jeffries as the British counter-intelligence agent who dreams up the wacky idea of implanting a bug in a bulldog. When the pooch is then presented as gift to the Soviet prime minister, the perfect spy is born -- until that spy begins to ail, raising the possibility that a Soviet vet could find the bug when treating the canine.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: After establishing himself in both the WCW and ECW, wrestler "Stone Cold" Steve Austin became a true superstar in the WWE. Track this popular fighter's incredible career by reliving all of his intense rivalries, championships and memorable matches. Experience the many highs Austin reached as WWE champion and the terrible lows he faced, such as the near career-ending neck injury he suffered in a match against Owen Hart.
link.title: synopsis
The Legacy of Stone Cold Steve Austin: Disc 1
The Legacy of Stone Cold Steve Austin: Disc 2
The Legacy of Stone Cold Steve Austin: Disc 3

link.synopsis: Enjoy a blast from the past with this fun collection of classic animated commercials. Hailing from the 1950s, '60s and '70s, these advertisements feature characters such as Bugs Bunny and the Pink Panther hawking everything from cereal to Tang. Others include Wild Root Cream Oil, Frito Bandito, Quisp and many more. A special feature allows viewers to click on each commercial's subtitle and get studio, voice-over artist and animator information.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Touch That Dial: TV's Best Commercials
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Commercial Parodies
Tales of the Gold Monkey: The Complete Series
The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp: From Ellsworth to Tombstone

link.synopsis: Looking back on Coldplay's phenomenal career with an independent eye, this retrospective program rolls out rare archival footage and extensive interviews with members of the band. Live performance footage includes clips from concerts at Glastonbury and appearances on "Later with Jools Holland," with memorable versions of "Yellow," "God Put a Smile upon Your Face," "Politik," "Everything's Not Lost" and "Life Is for Living."

link.synopsis: Viewers of NBC's "Late Night with Conan O'Brien" have long clamored for a collection of vintage poops from Triumph the Insult Comic Dog. Since his first appearance on the show in 1997, the raunchy, cigar-smoking, bow tie-wearing, poodle-humping pooch has made dog meat of everything, from the esteemed Westminster Dog Show to his celebrity-trashing of Bon Jovi, "Hollywood Squares" and the "Video Music Awards." Includes bonus footage.
link.title: synopsis
Triumph the Insult Comic Dog: Come Poop with Me
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Saturday TV Funhouse
Yucko the Clown: The Damn Show
The Best of the Colbert Report

title.short: The Best of Triumph the Insult Comic Dog

link.synopsis: When student filmmaker Nick Hastings (Dana Gould) finds his best friend Courtney (Eliza Coyle) staring down 30 with no Mr. Right in sight, he decides to make a documentary about her love life. Soon, Nick is tagging along with Courtney as she tries her hand at video dating, joins a therapy group for singles and tries to sort out her relationship with her on-again, off-again live-in boyfriend (Sean Masterson).
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: England's "Dodgy" Dave Courtney is back. The former mob muscle for the Kray family dishes the dirt on the latest underworld happenings, but it's the "trail from hell" that really riles Courtney and is his biggest battle -- the court case against his wife. With his bad-boy demeanor yet likable personality, Courtney's criminal past has given him folk hero status. See what the star of "Hell to Pay" is up to now.
link.title: synopsis
The Life and Legacy of Spike Milligan
Aileen Wuornos: The Selling of a Serial Killer
The Man Who Would Be Polka King
H.H. Holmes: America's First Serial Killer
Danny Greene: The Rise and Fall of the Irishman
Aileen: Life and Death of a Serial Killer
Fashion Victim: The Killing of Gianni Versace
Stoked: The Rise and Fall of Gator
Scottsboro: An American Tragedy: American Experience
Superfly: The True Untold Story of Frank Lucas the American Gangster
The Last Mogul: The Life and Times of Lew Wasserman
The Life of Rayful Edmond: The Rise & Fall 1

link.synopsis: Great joy is found in the unexpected. A pharmacist and his wife discover this truth when their ordinary life is altered by the return of an old friend who was thought to have died in Vietnam, and by the arrival of an attractive summer houseguest. Set in a small fishing town on the coast of Puerto Rico, this endearing story of love and loss reveals how four people are emotionally transformed when destiny brings them together.
link.title: synopsis
WWE Edge: A Decade of Decadence

link.synopsis: Living in the time of Christ, a young religious scholar named Joel (John Beal) leads an uprising against the Romans ...  until his aggressive instincts are curbed by the influence of Jesus of Nazareth. This 1939 film from director Irving Pichel centers on Joel's transformation from a revolutionary to a pacifist who, in true Christ-like fashion, even learns to forgive the soldier who murdered his brother.
link.title: synopsis
Bang the Drum Slowly / The Battler
The Ten Commandments: The Greatest Spectacle Ever Told
The Man Who Could Work Miracles
Val Lewton: Cat People / The Curse of the Cat People
Dr. Cyclops / Cult of the Cobra
Our Daily Bread & Other Films of the Great Depression

link.synopsis: Years after his Uncle Charles (Dick Sargent) cruelly and unjustly has him committed to a mental asylum, Robert Knight (Bernard White) manages to escape and immediately tracks Charles down at an upcoming family reunion. Along the way, Robert makes a detour to abduct his cousin (Lauren Woodland). After sharing a meal and conversation, the two set off to the reunion, where Robert plans to dispense gory vengeance.
link.title: synopsis
The Murders in the Rue Morgue

link.synopsis: In this animated film (written and illustrated by Don Freeman) that's a perfect fit for inquisitive toddlers, a teddy bear named Corduroy pines for a deserving someone to take him home from the department store. And finding his lost button may just be the key to making his dream come true. Corduroy searches the store top to bottom -- when nobody's looking -- for the lost button.
link.title: synopsis
Growing up with Winnie the Pooh: Love & Friendship
Growing up with Winnie the Pooh: It's Playtime with Pooh

link.synopsis: Kids will love this collection of classic tales from the Scholastic Storybook Treasures library that allows young readers to follow along with their favorite characters -- including Corduroy, the overalls-wearing teddy created by author Don Freeman. Other books brought to life in this compilation include Mike Mulligan and His Steam Shovel, The Happy Lion and I Love You Like Crazy Cakes, plus a trio of bonus stories.

link.synopsis: This musical compilation features more than 90 minutes of previously unreleased live punk video. The 36 songs on this video include multiple tracks each from the bands Propagandhi, Supersuckers, Good Clean Fun, Diesel Boy, Fleshies, Boris The Sprinkler, theLINE, Blocko, Degrassi and Atom & His Package.

link.synopsis: This compilation will really give you a laugh and evoke some nostalgic memories along the way. Sit back and enjoy a wacky collection of celebrities hawking wares in these classic television commercials and public service announcements. The line-up includes established actors and athletes as well as stars before they became famous.

link.synopsis: Since its 1996 debut, Cincinnati's Scribble Jam has grown to be regarded as the country's biggest hip-hop festival. This double feature includes highlights from the 2001 and 2002 events, and includes appearances by some of the genre's biggest names. In addition to scorching performances, the Rhymesayers celebrate their 10th anniversary, a DJ battle pits Scratch Bastard against DJ Squint and the festival hosts its first beat box battle.

link.synopsis: A fascinating window into America's past, this extensive compilation of vintage television commercials features spots extolling the virtues of Jolly Green Giant vegetables, Marlboro cigarettes, Alka-Seltzer, Silly Putty and Ajax cleanser. Baby boomers and pop-culture aficionados will love turning back the clock to see some of the famous pitchmen, who include Jonathan Winters, Ozzie Nelson and Ed McMahon.

link.synopsis: After his artful cohort Taishi Kuhonbutsu talks him into entering the weird world of comics devotees, high schooler Kazuki Sendou finds himself attending a giant convention and creating his own comic, much to the dismay of his gal pal Mizuki Takase. The whole anime industry gets skewered in this popular -- and irreverent -- Japanese series featuring the animation of Masao Nakada and Mima Yoshikawa.

link.synopsis: Life imitates art when a famous comic book artist is found dead, murdered in a gruesome fashion that's eerily similar to a scenario from his latest issue. Overcome with grief but ready for revenge, the artist's son chooses to do the only thing that makes any sense: transform himself into his father's most popular character and fight a local triad group led by the menacing Black Devil. Patrick Keung, Siu Lung Sik and Cherie Kong co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Fists of Shaolin / Out of Danger
Shaolin vs. Evil Dead: Ultimate Power

link.synopsis: With Comic Relief 2006, Billy Crystal, Whoopi Goldberg and Robin Williams continue their crusade to raise money for the victims of Hurricane Katrina and other charitable causes by hitting people right where it counts -- the funny bone. Still not sated? You can also take a look back at the best Comic Relief moments of the past 20 years in a bonus special featuring appearances by Stephen Colbert, George Carlin, Dave Chappelle and more.

link.synopsis: The second volume of this four-part series includes six of Stone Cold Steve Austin's most memorable matches inside the ring. Highlights are bouts against Jake "The Snake" Roberts and Bret "Hit Man" Hart, among other opponents.

link.synopsis: Some commercials have become more popular than the television shows during which they air. Companies pay astronomical prices for airtime, often with extremely profitable results and commercials that stick in consumers' minds for years to come. Host David Leisure takes an unforgettable look at some of the most hilarious, ingenious and inventive commercials the world has ever seen.

link.synopsis: Based on Grant Jeffrey's best-selling book &NFi;The Handwriting of God&NFi_;, this companion program uses modern technology to unlock the Bible's secrets. Jeffrey maintains that the Old Testament foretold tragic events of the recent and distant past, including the 1995 Oklahoma City bombing and the holocaust. Fans of the book will appreciate the video's synthesis of computer animation and graphic documentation.

Lost Science of the Soul: Breaking the Reptilian Code

link.synopsis: Meet eight beautiful, intelligent and fun young women who also happen to be huge comic book fans. Gathering together one evening to talk about the comic books they love -- and hate -- these gals lounge, eat chocolate, guzzle wine and give you the low-down on manga, anime, Neil Gaiman, Marvel and DC, the universe in general and men in particular. Be a fly on the wall as these smart, savvy and outspoken chicks dish about more than just pop culture.

link.synopsis: Nine college girls try to make it in the competitive world of manga, or Japanese graphic novels, in this popular anime TV series. Based on the Dreamcast PC game Comic Party -- which itself is inspired by the twice-annual Tokyo Comic Market, where comic artists gather to share their work -- "Comic Party Revolution TV" follows the adventures of aspiring artists Kazuki, Taishi and Mizuki as they immerse themselves in the fanboy-fangirl culture.

Comic Party Revolution TV: Vol. 3: The Party's Over!

link.synopsis: Young teen Steph and her three pals find themselves hopelessly lost deep in the wilderness when their guide perishes while leading them on a backcountry canoe trip. Now the four girls must survive the perils of the wild and find their way back.

link.synopsis: Although their marriage is a traditional arranged agreement, wealthy Raj falls madly in love with Nayantara at first sight, causing him to act like an idiot in front of his beautiful fiancée. But Raj has an opportunity to win her over when he stumbles on two burglars at Nayantara's house. Avadhoot Gupte, Sagarika Bam, Arvind Mehra, Toshi, Neetu and Areez Gandhi provide voices for this charming animated movie from India.

link.synopsis: Profiling prolific author and educator Noam Chomsky -- widely recognized as the father of modern linguistics -- this thought-provoking collection of frank interviews, lectures and speeches elucidates his political philosophy and world views. Known for his staunch opposition to the Vietnam War and his condemnation of subsequent U.S. foreign policy, Chomsky is a standard-bearer for American dissidents.
link.title: synopsis
Power and Terror: Noam Chomsky in Our Times
Noam Chomsky: Distorted Morality: America's War on Terror?
Howard Zinn: You Can't Be Neutral on a Moving Train

link.synopsis: From the horror schlockmeisters at Troma Studios comes this amphibious assault that'll have you leaping from your seat in fright. Years ago, 11-year-old Kelly's family was killed by a rabid ribbitter of behemoth proportions. Now, the young man returns to the fearsome frog's lair to eliminate the creature and collect the sunken treasure the green giant's been guarding beneath the murky depths of Shadow Lake. Question is: Who'll croak first?
link.title: synopsis
Del Tenney Double Feature: The Horror of Party Beach/The Curse of the Living Corpse
Monstroid: It Came from the Lake
Terror Tales: Black Voodoo Exorcist / Devil Hunter

link.synopsis: GiGi Erneta stars in director Jesse Weathington's low-budget crime thriller as Lisa Travanti, a Los Angeles police officer who's pushed to desperate measures when she's betrayed by the justice she's sworn to uphold. To add insult to injury, her fiancé and her best friend turn their backs on her, too. Lynn Dee Smith, Joseph Corri, Danny Molina and Allegra Curtis co-star in this sizzling revenge tale penned by Erneta.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: While using his creativity and determination to try to land a record deal with a major label, hip-hop hopeful Sensational encounters the dark side of the music industry and learns that chasing his dreams can be an extremely painful experience. Based on true stories, this urban drama features a tight soundtrack with songs from Spectre, Anti-Pop Consortium, Scotty Hard, Mentol Nomad, Bimos and more.

WC: Bandana Swangin: All That Glitters Ain't Gold

link.synopsis: In director Ismail Merchant's homage to a nearly extinct language, milquetoast professor Deven (Om Puri) is elated to land an assignment profiling the great Urdu poet Nur (Shashi Kapoor) for a scholarly journal. But when they meet, a dismayed Deven finds that Nur is hardly the man of his repute -- awash in liquor and lamenting his artistic decay to a bunch of sad-sack groupies. Puri and Kapoor deliver superb performances in this engaging opus.
link.title: synopsis
Kal Ho Naa Ho: Tomorrow May Never Come
The Ballad of the Sad Café
When Did You Last See Your Father?

link.synopsis: Determined to make it, struggling actor Jackson launches an intense campaign to persuade one of the biggest movie stars around to act in his film. But when he meets industry insider Amy, he finds himself torn between success and compassion.
link.title: synopsis
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story
The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou
The Life and Hard Times of Guy Terrifico
Glick Doesn't Do Red Carpet: Jiminy Glick at the Independent Spirit Awards

link.synopsis: The Gaza Strip is a veritable island of conflict, an area of just 288 square kilometers housing 1 million people -- most of them Palestinians -- cordoned off by an electric fence. Getting people in and out of the region, which is controlled by the Israeli government, is a daily drama characterized by terror, frustration and violence, a tension deftly captured in this documentary produced by a Palestinian and Israeli crew.
link.title: synopsis
Amandla! A Revolution in Four Part Harmony
Return from India: A Story of Forbidden Love
The English Sheik and the Yemeni Gentleman
In the Mirror of Maya Deren

link.synopsis: In two lectures and a 45-minute interview, intellectual and political activist Noam Chomsky -- credited as the father of modern linguistics -- delivers an unabashed criticism of the Bush administration's record on terrorism, framing the president's invasion of Iraq as part of an "imperial grand strategy." Filmed in 2003, this collection of Chomsky's personal views also provides an effective overview of the global political climate.
link.title: synopsis
Noam Chomsky: Distorted Morality: America's War on Terror?
Manufacturing Consent: Noam Chomsky and the Media
Noam Chomsky: Rebel Without a Pause
Howard Zinn: You Can't Be Neutral on a Moving Train

This Film Is Not Yet Rated
The Prisoner or: How I Planned to Kill Tony Blair
Wal-Mart: The High Cost of Low Price
For the Bible Tells Me So
National Geographic: Inside Shock and Awe

link.synopsis: In this lecture filmed live at New York City's Riverside Church in 2009, political philosopher Noam Chomsky discusses the roots of the economic crisis and the role that class interests play in driving domestic and foreign policy in the United States. In addition, Chomsky explores the prospect of worker self-management when it comes to corporate and government "action plans" in the face of financial crisis.
link.title: synopsis
Power and Terror: Noam Chomsky in Our Times
Plunder: The Crime of Our Time
Noam Chomsky: Rebel Without a Pause

title.short: Chomsky: Crisis and Hope: Theirs and Ours

link.synopsis: Renowned scholar and tireless critic of America's international policies and military behavior, Noam Chomsky delivers a lecture on the history and future of the conflict between Israel and the Palestinian people. Chomsky emphasizes the key influence of the Israel lobby on U.S. politicians and overall public opinion, examines the prospects for peace, and speculates on the true aims and interests of American power as it's expressed worldwide.
link.title: synopsis
Power and Terror: Noam Chomsky in Our Times

link.synopsis: Director Michael Bortman also penned the screenplay for this potent drama based on Robert Boswell's novel. Sparked by a troubled relationship between family patriarch Edward (Peter Coyote) and defiant eldest son Charley (Vincent D'Onofrio), the dysfunctional Warren clan finds themselves beleaguered by conflict and tainted by scandal. But things come to a head when middle son Tom (Peter Berg) returns home after dropping out of college.
link.title: synopsis
The Last Time I Committed Suicide

link.synopsis: Bindi Irwin is having a wild animal dance party in her jungle tree house, and children of all ages are invited. Backed by the Crocmen and her father, naturalist Steve "the Crocodile Hunter" Irwin, Bindi demonstrates nine aerobic dance routines that teach kids about different animal behavior patterns. Dad Steve also takes to the kitchen to whip up some delicious and healthy snacks -- and leaves behind one huge mess!

link.synopsis: Legendary chanteuse Rosemary Clooney -- the "girl singer" aunt of Oscar-winning actor George Clooney -- shines in this assortment of musical performances from her short-lived television show that ran from 1956 to 1957. Selections include "My Blue Heaven," "Moonlight in Vermont," "They Can't Take that Away from Me," "I've Got My Love to Keep Me Warm," "Come On-A My House," "Mambo Italiano" and "I'll Be Seeing You."

link.synopsis: When mother-daughter teams compete to win a beauty pageant, anything can -- and does -- happen. Rivalries burn and tempers flare as each duo tries to win the hearts of the judges to score the $100,000 cash prize. Will the swimsuits fit? Can they coordinate the big dance number? Will they demonstrate a command of current events? Beauty and stress collide as the intergenerational teams strive to claim the money and ultimate prize: matching tiaras!

link.synopsis: Little Olya never listened to her grandmother's advice. But one day, an old magic mirror allows Olya to meet her own reflection, a girl named Yalo. Together, they enter a kingdom of crooked mirrors, where normal mirrors are outlawed because evil, dishonest people can't face their true selves. A homecoming for Olya proves challenging when she tries to get Yalo to lose her bad habits. An enchanting, whimsical fantasy for the whole family!
link.title: synopsis
Sleeping Beauty: Classic Motion Picture with the Kirov Ballet
Journey to the Center of the Earth

link.synopsis: When a gang of amateur sleuths known as the Sphinx Club sends a crook to jail, the criminal's sinister Crooked Circle organization plots revenge. They lure the Sphinxes to a reportedly haunted house in a plot to murder them all. Brand Osborne (Ben Lyon) tries to save the day, Nora (Zasu Pitts) and Arthur (James Gleason) provide comic relief, and the shadowy occultists lure one victim after another into the darkness in this lighthearted mystery.

link.synopsis: After a hostile Indian tribe kidnaps his sister, young Sam Sutter (Stewart Petersen) sets out to find her. He enlists the help of a rough-and-ready trapper named Russian (Richard Boone) to aid in the rescue. But when the tribe, led by the ruthless Temkai (Geoffrey Land), closes in on our heroes, Sam must undergo the ancient trial of "Crooked Sky" to save his captive sister in this rousing Western, a loose remake of John Ford's The Searchers.
link.title: synopsis
The Return of a Man Called Horse

link.synopsis: Once he starts working for the Enron Corporation, young trader Brian Cruver (Christian Kane) is quickly caught up in the company's obsession with greed and partying. When Enron suddenly files for bankruptcy, Cruver is swept up in the disastrous collapse. Brian Dennehy and Shannon Elizabeth also star in this drama based on real-life events and on the book Anatomy of Greed by former Enron employee Brian Cruver.

title.regular: The Crooked E: The Unshredded Truth About Enron

link.synopsis: Rosemary Clooney was a songbird in every sense of the word. She sang sweetly like a canary; phrased tunes freely, as if soaring through the lyrics; and dominated like an eagle over both easy and difficult arrangements and different genres such as pop, jazz and the blues. This collection captures Clooney's memorable performances as she runs through her best hits.

link.synopsis: Kirk Douglas stars in this classic Western about amiable convict Paris Pitman, who's hidden a half million in stolen loot. Now, he just needs to persuade his prison cronies to escape and help him recover the cash. Henry Fonda co-stars the idealistic warden determined to bring back Paris dead or alive. This clever and blackly comedic shoot-'em-up features a sterling support cast, including Hume Cronyn, Warren Oates and Burgess Meredith.

link.synopsis: Johnny Mack Brown stars in these back-to-back features centering on the exploits of outlaws in the Wild West. In The Lone Star Trail, rancher Blaze Barker gets released from prison and is determined to get revenge on the townspeople who framed him. In The Crooked Trail, naïve prospector Jim Blake goes into partnership on his gold claim with outlaw gunman Harve Tarlton -- with disastrous results that include Tarlton's kidnapping of Blake's bride.

link.synopsis: James Ellison and Russell Hayden star in this trio of Thomas Carr-directed B Westerns -- half of the six films the director made in a single month by using the same casts, costumes and locations for each. In Crooked River, Shamrock (Ellison) searches for his parents' killer and Lucky (Hayden) makes an unlikely bandit; in Colorado Ranger, Shamrock and Lucky are undercover rangers; and in Fast on the Draw, a gun-shy Shamrock becomes town marshal.
